Posts.Content: Hi all, I started herceptin in November last year, had 4 cycles of it, had to stop in February due to me moving on to fec cycle of chemo, I’m due to have number 5 of herceptin on Friday, I was wondering because you are on it for a year is it a year since you started on it or do you have to complete the full 17 cycles of it, I am also part of the Roscoe trial. Many thanks.
Posts.Title: Regarding herceptin

Posts.Content: Thank you, I shall ask my bcn when I see her on Friday. X
Posts.Title: Regarding herceptin

Posts.Content: Hope it goes well for you shirl3. X
Posts.Title: Update from oncologist.

Posts.Content: Hi guys just to let you know that my cancer is stable, the lump has not grown which is good, I’ve 2 more rounds of chemo to go, I get a scan again next month and my heart checked, if after the next scan nothing has changed with the lump they will move me on to more chemo to see if that will work in shrinking the lump, they have said better doing that before I have surgery.  Oncologist has also said because I am taking part in the Roscoe trial and they do the scan after 2 rounds of chemo they don’t expect to see much change until after the 3rd round of chemo.
Posts.Title: Update from oncologist.

Posts.Content: I had my 2nd chemo and herceptin on the 20th of December, I have had a dry tickly cough for a few days, I have now lost my voice, I was wondering if this is normal please.
Posts.Title: Lost my voice

Posts.Content: Hi thanks for the reply, I got some advice today from the pharmacist on the group, I was told to try simple linctus and jakemans lozenges, touch wood so far seem to be doing the trick my cough has eased a little and I can talk a little now.  I am doing the Roscoe trial and my chemo is the tc part along with herceptin.  I am due for an ultrasound next week to see how the chemo is working and also seeing the oncologist.  I then have my 3rd round of chemo on the 10th of January, all being well the 31st of January will be my last chemo and then it will be a waiting game to see when I will get surgery, I am dreading the surgery as I’m not sure whether I will lose all my breast or whether the tumour will just come out, I will also be having lymph nodes removed but not sure how many yet.
Posts.Title: Lost my voice

Posts.Content: Thank you for reply, I’m feeling fine otherwise, I have no temp, a bit of a runny nose but that’s it.  I was just after some advice of whether this was normal or not.
Posts.Title: Lost my voice

Posts.Content: Thanks for the reply happygolucky280, I hope everything goes well for you and you get to enjoy you’re holiday, sorry to hear about the cancer on you’re liver. I have had a few days where I have just broke down and cried since being diagnosed, it’s my kids that keep me going and make me stay positive, also my grandmother that I lost the week I found out about my cancer, she had a liver transplant 6 years ago, her strength and positivity were phenomenal, I think I am like her, I know if she was here today she would want me to have the strength that she did. Take care. Xx
Posts.Title: Lost my voice

Posts.Content: Thank you, I’ve not got a sore throat this time, it’s a dry tickly cough, I’ve coughed that much I’ve lost my voice, I’ve never slept for a few days as every time I get comfy I have a coughing fit.
Posts.Title: Lost my voice

Posts.Content: Thank you for replying, I’m starting to get my voice back today, I think if I didn’t have the dry tickly cough I would fine, I had the dry tickly cough after my 1st chemo but had a really sore throat the doctor put me on antibiotics, this time is the cough and no sore throat and feeling fine otherwise. X
Posts.Title: Lost my voice

Posts.Content: I waswondering if any ladies have any tips on comfy bras, my bras feel too tight and uncomfortable to wear at the minute, is it advisable to go up a size or cup size to make me feel more comfortable.  I am big chested at the minute my bra size is 42c. Any advice would be appreciated. X
Posts.Title: Advice on bras

Posts.Content: Yeah I managed to get chemo today, my bloods came back normal today,  spoke to my bcn nurse before hand and she has said that this may happen as the injection after the t part of chemo I got boosted my white blood cells up.  That’s number 6 of chemo done now I get number 7 on the 5th of April and the last one on the 26th of April.  Then the next part after the chemo will be preparing myself for surgery as not sure whether I will get a lumpectomy or mastectomy, it all depends on how well the fec has shrunk my lump, then after surgery it will be whether I will need any more treatment in the way of chemo or radiotherapy.
Posts.Title: Bit worried

Posts.Content: Due to get 2nd round of fec chemo tomorrow, got my phone assessment from chemo unit today and they have said that my blood results are at 1.4 and they need to be 1.5, this is the 1st time I’ve had problems with my blood, I’ve to have my bloods done again tomorrow.  My bloods were fine during my 4 rounds of the tc part of chemo and herceptin as I got the injection the next day for boosting my blood count up. I was just wondering if any other ladies have had this on the fec part of chemo.
Posts.Title: Bit worried
